title: A Tale of Two Pop-Ups: Amazon, Primark Aim to Capture NYC Holiday Magic
snippet: Two takes on the holiday pop-up, from Amazon and Primark, present an interesting study of the modelâ€™s variability and utility.
content: A Tale of Two Pop-Ups: Amazon, Primark Aim to Capture NYC Holiday Magic - Retail TouchPoints Emerald Media Network Advertise Linkedin X-twitter Facebook Instagram Youtube Advertisement Latest Resources View All Resources Research Reports iPapers Webinars Events Digital Event Digital Event Tradeshow Digital Event Digital Event Podcast ThinkTank Hub Latest Resources View All Resources Research Reports iPapers Webinars Events Podcast ThinkTank Hub About Us Advertise With Us Blog Awards TouchPoints TV Privacy Policy Subscribe Trending Listen Now: What DoorDash Plans to Deliver Next A Tale of Two Pop-Ups: Amazon, Primark Aim to Capture NYC Holiday Magic Is Retail Ready for a World Where Crypto is just Another Way to Pay? Facebook Marketplace Beefs up Fashion Offerings with Ebay, Poshmark Integrations Walmart Names Furner to Replace Retiring McMillon as CEO This Fish Story is True: How Fulton Fish Market Became an Ecommerce Whale Search Search A Tale of Two Pop-Ups: Amazon, Primark Aim to Capture NYC Holiday Magic November 18, 2025 at 11:09 AM EST By Nicole Silberstein Inside Amazon's Home for the Holidays pop-up in NYC. (Retail TouchPoints) The holiday season is replete with holly, garland, salesâ€¦and pop-ups, especially in high-traffic tourist destinations like New York City. This year, two takes on the holiday pop-up, from Amazon and Primark , present an interesting study of the modelâ€™s variability and utility. The two companies took markedly different approaches to their pop-up experiences, although neither activation supported on-site sales. Online-only Amazon highlighted its Holiday Shop offerings in a richly decorated, three -story, three -day pop-up adjacent to tourist hotspot Bryant Park., Primark has opened a small â€œStudioâ€ space in the NYU-dominated NoHo neighborhood that will remain open through the holidays and beyond, aimed at building buzz for the Spring 2026 opening of its Herald Square flagship . Two very different companies (not least because one dominates U.S. ecommerce and the other has no ecommerce at all) with two very different goals, and yet they both turned to non-transactional pop-ups to achieve their aims. Hereâ€™s how these varying expressions of the pop-up model played out. Amazon Brings its Holiday Shop to Life The â€œhome theaterâ€ room in Amazonâ€™s Home for the Holidays pop-up. (Retail TouchPoints) Amazonâ€™s first-ever â€œHome for the Holidays Social Content Studioâ€ was staged from Nov 10-14 at GH on the Park , an event space that at one point in time, long ago, was a stately home overlooking Bryant Park. For the event, Amazon transformed the three stories of the space back into a home, albeit with a modern bent. Advertisement Fully decorated themed rooms included a kitchen and walk-in pantry, dining room, â€œboudoirâ€ lounge area, playroom, theater, home office and gym. Each area was stuffed to the brim with products from Amazonâ€™s Holiday Shop , with QR codes placed throughout to â€œshopâ€ the products on display. Image: Retail TouchPoints However, the goal of the event wasnâ€™t sales. Rather, it was a chance for Amazon to break out from the expansive yet restrictive walls of the internet. The pop-up goal was to bring Amazonâ€™s online assortment to life for media and influencers, all busily preparing their holiday hot lists and seasonal shopping recommendations. The idea was to create an immersive experience (which it certainly was) that not only allowed for product trials but also created opportunities for content creation and â€œphoto moments.â€ Amazon also took the opportunity to highlight its climate-friendly product offerings with a dedicated sustainability section that featured products from its Climate Pledge Friendly program and Amazon Resale , including a curated Climate Pledge Fashion Edit available on Amazon-owned Shopbop . Primark Builds Buzz for Herald Square Store Image: Retail TouchPoints Downtown, Primark hosted its own very different pop-up, the Primark Studio, at 55 Great Jones Street in NoHo. The locati

A medley of tech gifts for everyone on your holiday shopping list Finding the perfect tech gifts can be tricky, but here's a quick guide to help. Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Click to share on Reddit (Opens in new window) Reddit Click to print (Opens in new window) Print A Nintendo Switch 2 display appears at a Best Buy in Nashville, Tenn., on une 5, 2025, (AP Photo/George Walker IV) By Associated Press PUBLISHED: November 16, 2025 at 8:00 AM PST By SHAWN CHEN, AP Technology Writer NEW YORK (AP) â€” Itâ€™s the most wonderful time of the year, unless you want to find the perfect gifts for tech lovers . Related Articles This simple polenta and mushroom dish will elevate your Thanksgiving table Frumpy Mom: My kitchen has gone on strike against me This weekâ€™s bestsellers at Southern Californiaâ€™s independent bookstores Lamb of God, Kublai Khan TX, and more are coming to Los Angeles in April Klatch Coffeeâ€™s new cafe is open in Rancho Cucamonga Thereâ€™s a lot of slop to sift through as we get closer to the holidays, many interests to appeal to and a whole bunch of deals-that-arenâ€™t-deals flashing before our screens. So hereâ€™s a guide â€” and some sales â€” to help you get started on your gift shopping journey. For your gamers The Nintendo Switch 2 was the biggest and most anticipated console launch of 2025, and if history is any indication, it will be increasingly harder to find as Christmas approaches. But for the gamers in your life â€” both young and adult â€” this is the gift to get. Nintendoâ€™s Black Friday deals for the console and games have been announced but the best bang for your buck may be the console bundles. The Switch 2 is still available as just the console only for $449 or bundled with Mario Kart World for $499 . A new $499 bundle is now available where the console is packaged with PokÃ©mon Legends: Z-A. Games retail for about $70 a piece, so you do save a little with bundles. Need a new iPhone? title: Top Stories: Apple Silicon Turns 5, iPhone Pocket, and More
snippet: It's hard to believe we're halfway through November already, as 2025 rapidly draws to a close with no firm signs of several smaller hardware updates we've been hoping to see before the end of the year,
content: Top Stories: Apple Silicon Turns 5, iPhone Pocket, and More - MacRumors Skip to Content Got a tip for us? Let us know a. Send us an email b. Anonymous form close Podcast Instagram Facebook Twitter Mastodon YouTube Notifications RSS Newsletter Open Menu Front Page Roundups Show Roundups AirPods 4 AirPods Max AirPods Pro 3 Apple Black Friday Apple Deals Apple Pay Apple Pro Display XDR Apple Studio Display Apple TV Apple Vision Pro Apple Watch 11 Apple Watch SE 3 Apple Watch Ultra 3 CarPlay HomePod HomePod mini iMac iOS 26 iPad iPad Air iPad mini iPad Pro iPadOS 26 iPhone 16 iPhone 16e iPhone 17 iPhone 17 Pro iPhone 18 iPhone Air Mac mini Mac Pro Mac Studio MacBook Air MacBook Pro macOS Tahoe 26 watchOS 26 Guides How Tos Reviews Buyer's Guide Forums Podcast Instagram Facebook Twitter Mastodon YouTube Notifications RSS Newsletter Visit Forums Search Close Search Open Sidebar iOS 26 macOS Tahoe 26 iPadOS 26 iPhone 17 iPhone Air iPhone 17 Pro iPhone 16e iPhone 16 MacBook Pro Apple Vision Pro iMac Mac mini HomePod Apple TV iPad Pro AirPods 4 Apple Pro Display XDR Apple Watch Ultra 3 HomePod mini Mac Pro MacBook Air iPad AirPods Max AirPods Pro 3 Apple Deals Apple Studio Display Apple Watch 11 Apple Watch SE 3 Mac Studio iPad Air iPad mini iPhone 18 CarPlay Apple Black Friday Apple Pay watchOS 26 All > Front Page Roundups Guides How Tos Reviews Buyer's Guide Upcoming Products Forums Archives Tips / Contact Us Podcast Instagram Facebook Twitter Mastodon YouTube Notifications RSS Newsletter Top Stories: Apple Silicon Turns 5, iPhone Pocket, and More Saturday November 15, 2025 6:00 am PST by MacRumors Staff It's hard to believe we're halfway through November already, as 2025 rapidly draws to a close with no firm signs of several smaller hardware updates we've been hoping to see before the end of the year, although we did get one surprising new iPhone accessory this week. This week also saw the fifth anniversary of the very successful Apple silicon effort on the Mac, contrasted with the future of the iPhone Air seeming shakier than ever. On the software side, Apple made some more tweaks with the second beta of iOS 26.2 and released the Digital ID feature to allow users to add their U.S. passports to the Wallet app, so read on below for all the details! Top Stories Five Years of Apple Silicon: M1 to M5 Performance Comparison This week marked the fifth anniversary of the Apple silicon chip that replaced Intel chips in Apple's Mac lineup. The first Apple silicon chip, the M1, was unveiled on November 10, 2020, and it debuted in the MacBook Air, Mac mini, and 13-inch MacBook Pro. The â€ŒM1â€Œ chip was impressive when it launched, featuring the "world's fastest CPU core" and industry-leading performance per watt, and it's only improved since then. We've had five total generations of Apple silicon chips, with the M5 unveiled in the 14-inch â€ŒMacBook Proâ€Œ just last month, so check out our look at how Apple's latest M-series chip compares to the first one . Apple Debuts iPhone Pocket, a Limited Edition iPod Sock-Style Accessory While Apple branched out into the crossbody strap accessory market with the iPhone 17 lineup, the company has now gone a step further with the release of the special-edition iPhone Pocket , a knitted accessory much like a stretchy pocket or sock that can hold an iPhone, AirPods, or other everyday items. Available in a number of vibrant color options, the iPhone Pocket comes in both short strap ($149.95) and long strap ($229.95) options, although it almost immediately sold out in the United States upon launch. The iPhone Pocket was created in a partnership between Apple and Japanese fashion house ISSEY MIYAKE, whose namesake founder was the designer of the iconic black turtleneck worn by Steve Jobs. iPhone Air Sales Are So Bad That Apple's Delaying the Next-Generation Version The thin and light iPhone Air has sold so poorly that Apple has decided to delay the launch of the next-generation â€Œversion that was scheduled to come out

title: New Fabletics Flagship Brings AI-Powered Operations to Westfield Century City
snippet: Fabletics operates more than 100 brick-and-mortar stores selling its athleisurewear products, and an impressive 50% of ...

Facebook Marketplace Beefs up Fashion Offerings with Ebay, Poshmark Integrations Walmart Names Furner to Replace Retiring McMillon as CEO This Fish Story is True: How Fulton Fish Market Became an Ecommerce Whale Search Search New Fabletics Flagship Brings AI-Powered Operations to Westfield Century City November 19, 2025 at 11:47 AM EST By Adam Blair Fabletics Century City flagship store. Images courtesy Fabletics. Fabletics will open its new West Coast flagship store on Nov. 20 at Westfield Century City , bringing the brandâ€™s tech-forward style of retailing to the iconic Los Angeles mall. The store, which will process more than 70 billion data points each day, will feature smart fitting rooms that automatically log items into customer profiles, along with omnichannel data integration that provides store associates with instant access to customer purchase history, wish lists and personalized recommendations, translating to a 4X higher customer lifetime value. Fabletics operates more than 100 brick-and-mortar stores selling its athleisurewear products, and an impressive 50% of non-member shoppers join the brandâ€™s VIP membership program while in-store. Operations at the new Century City store will be managed by AI-powered systems designed to handle everything from inventory optimization to real-time employee coaching, and the store will use heat mapping and productivity analytics to maximize employee efficiency. The storeâ€™s fitting rooms, equipped with technology designed to track customer preferences, can offer curated product suggestions based on in-store availability. An in-room iPad allows customers to request different sizes, and the system also feeds conversion data to the Fabletics design team, influencing future product development. Fabletics Century City store interior. A modular store design provides a clean backdrop for the brandâ€™s full portfolio of womenâ€™s, menâ€™s and Scrubs products, while modular and movable fixtures allow the space to be transformed into an area for community events, workout classes and more. Advertisement In February 2025 Fabletics adopted a suite of supply chain management solutions from Blue Yonder, and in August 2025 Fabletics deployed an RFID-powered inventory management solution from GreyOrange in 74 of its 100+ stores.
